AD said that Memphis didn't double him much in the regular season although he understands that could change this series.
Anthony Davis joked that Dennis Schroder got on him for messing up his game-winner, but he was just happy that the end result was a win.

Anthony Davis credited the home crowd for getting the #Lakers back into the game.

"It was fun. The energy was there. This is what you dream about... It was electric tonight. I can't wait until we come back home for our two home games, I know it's gonna be even louder."
https://t.co/QJwFW3oLzl
LeBron called the Grizzlies a really good team that is really well coached. He also pointed out their balance with Ja Morant being the "head of the snake."

LeBron pointed out that the analytics said the Lakers had a 0.3% chance of making the playoffs after starting out 2-10.

He said at that point, all they hoped for is a chance to compete for the Larry O'Brien Trophy and now they have it.
AD hurt his shoulder a bit and Dennis rolled the ankle, but Darvin Ham says they both ensured him that they were ok.
Darvin Ham admits that he and his staff need to do a better job of moving Anthony Davis around to get him better looks knowing that the constant double teams are going to continue moving forward.
Darvin Ham says that he still has confidence in D'Angelo Russell and he told him that "we're gonna need him" moving forward and he expects him to bounce back against Memphis.

Darvin Ham:

"This game was the definition of having the 'next-play' mentality."

Darvin Ham on Dennis Schroder:

"He lives for those type of moments... It's Dennis. It's classic Dennis. We're fortunate that he's on our team."

Anthony Davis on Pat Bev saying he wants to knock the #Lakers out of the playoffs:

"That's fine. He can come try. He can come try. A lot of people have tried. We'll see Sunday. Sunday and Wednesday, we got one here and one there."

Lonnie Walker IV says the Lakers' togetherness off the court has allowed them to click so well on the court in such a short amount of time. He said they're always together, watching TV, getting a bite to eat, etc.

Lonnie Walker IV admitted that there has been times over the last few weeks that he's been down and hasn't felt like himself, but he appreciates the constant support he's received from his teammates and coaches.

"I'm 24 years old, I'm only growing, and the best is yet to come."

Lonnie Walker IV on his mindset:

"Just being even-keeled... Every day I've just been in the gym staying positive, understanding what we're trying to accomplish and just staying ready... I love these guys and I'm happy to be playing with them."

Darvin Ham on Fourth Quarter Dennis Schroder:

"He lives and thrives for those moments."

Darvin Ham pointed out a strong box-out by Lonnie in the first half that allowed AD to get a rebound, and the coaches showed the video of that to the team at halftime saying that they all need to continue playing with that type of intensity, doing the little things.

Darvin Ham:

"The first order of business is to take care of our own business. We need to keep having these performances on both sides of the ball for a full 48 minutes."

Darvin Ham:

"I would be remissed if I didn't mention Lonnie Walker... He's the definition of what a pro is supposed to do at this level... He didn't have to worry about getting ready, he's been staying ready. We don't win that game without him."

Thomas Bryant confirmed that Dennis said this during the timeout.

Russell Westbrook had 7 turnovers in the first half and none in the second. Darvin Ham didn't mind the ones in the first half though as they were "competitive turnovers" and then he "settled in" in the second half.

"I'm not worried about Russ. He's gonna be Russ."

Darvin Ham says that he told Schroder that he was gonna take him out of the game if he was limping because of his ankle but Dennis said he wanted to stay in. Darvin then said "alright, then you better be good" and Dennis responded:

LeBron was asked if he's worried that AD's injury may affect the Lakers' trade plans:

"Not a question for me... I play the game, I'm not in the front office."

LeBron says that AD's injury is "disappointing" considering how we he has been playing. He added he's trying to do what he can to keep AD's mind fresh to get through this time. 

"Understand that it's just temporary and hopefully he'll be back on the floor sooner than later"

LeBron credited Thomas Bryant for the "energy and effort" he has brought the Lakers this season. 

"Tonight he played great once again and we need that."

Darvin Ham says Austin Reaves turning his ankle "scared the hell" out of him. He noticed Austin wasn't looking right and took him out momentarily although he was happy to see he was able to eventually come back in.

Darvin Ham after a big sigh of relief:

"I'm just happy to get this W. It's hard to win in this league."

Anthony Davis appreciates Darvin Ham taking the blame here but he says it's not on the head coach.

"We had too much experience on the floor to not be able to execute late."
LeBron says the Lakers were in "scramble mode" on the last possession because they missed a coverage earlier in the possession, which led to the open Turner 3.

LeBron James:

"Everything has to go wrong for you to lose a game like that, and everything went wrong... They took the game from us and you give them credit."

Darvin Ham on LeBron's fourth quarter shooting:

"Those are looks he normally makes, they just didn't fall tonight. I'm totally comfortable with him taking those shots."

Darvin Ham says he wishes the Lakers would've been "a lot more aggressive" offensively in the fourth quarter.

"That falls on me. I'll take responsibility for that."

He also says offensive rebounds have plagued the Lakers the last few games and that was again the case late.
Westbrook said he hasn't gotten a chance to watch the final possession yet so he's not exactly sure what went wrong for the Lakers.

"If I see single coverage, I try to go attack and make the right play."

"That's on me."

Anthony Davis says the Lakers' defensive effort tonight was "terrible."

He adds they'll watch the film to see where they can be better but they just "wasn't ourselves on the defensive end tonight."

LeBron on Lakers defense:

"We never want it to happen but there's some games throughout the course of an 82-game season where you don't have it defensively and tonight we didn't have it."

He gave credit to Utah but said the Lakers need to be better defensively.
LeBron James says despite turning his ankle, he will be ready for Sunday's game against the Cavs.

Darvin Ham on the Lakers giving up 15 offensive rebounds:

"We just have to gang rebound and be committed to putting bodies on bodies."
Coach Ham added that he has a "huge laundry list" of things to show the team in their film session tomorrow.

Darvin Ham says the Lakers took a "huge step backwards tonight" defensively.

"We can't play like that... The overall picture that was painted by us defensively sucks."
Russell Westbrook says he's "just letting my play and my work speak for himself" and he's grateful to the man above when asked how it felt to get MVP chants tonight.

LeBron James called Matt Ryan a "sniper" and credited him for not losing his focus despite his rough shooting earlier in the night.

Darvin Ham:

"The way we gutted this one out is huge. We had a big fat L staring us in the eyes... The way we pulled out the win is a big shot in the arm as far as building a winning culture."
Darvin Ham says he wants to get Russell Westbrook in the conversation for Sixth Man of the Year.

Darvin Ham says it was a "total gut feeling" putting in Matt Ryan and drawing up a play for him even though he was having a rough shooting night.

"I trust the kid. I trust all my players."

He added he specifically told Reaves he needed to throw Matt the ball there.
Darvin Ham says the Lakers were "fortunate" to win that game after how they played down the stretch. He was pleased with the grit they showed by not folding though.

Russell Westbrook says he's "extremely, extremely" happy for Matt Ryan.

"I was happy to be able to see that for him."

When asked how his back feels, AD gave a one-word answer with a smile:

"Great."
Anthony Davis credited Austin Reaves for making a great pass to Matt Ryan and then "Matt did what he do."

LeBron on the advice he would give to Russell Westbrook:

"Flush it down the toilet and get ready for Sunday."

He was complimentary of Russ' play outside of his lack of shot-making.

LeBron James:

"When you play the right way, win, lose or draw, you can be happy about it. And we played the right way... We're continuing to take steps forward to get better as a ballclub."
Lonnie Walker IV says there was optimism in the locker room after this game tonight considering this is only their second game together. He believes they're making strides in the right direction.

Darvin Ham on Westbrook, Beverley and Nunn shooting 1-for-25:

"I trust them. They'll bounce back and play better next time around. We'll go and look at the film and see how we can help them be better."
Darvin Ham added that he 'couldn't be happier' with the Lakers 'no-quit mentality.'

Darvin Ham wasn't pleased with the Lakers' defensive discipline, believing they were fouling too much. He was happy with how hard his team played though stating it can help build an identity for them.

LeBron on what he saw from the Lakers tonight:

"Some great moments, some not-so-good moments and that comes from a team that's coming together for the first time... But I loved the way we competed."

(via @SpectrumSN)

Russell Westbrook says coming off the bench in the final preseason game "absolutely" contributed to his hamstring injury since his routine was different than normal.

(via @SpectrumSN)

Darvin Ham says he wants the Lakers to start off games in "attack mode" and "there's no one better than him at that" when referring to Russell Westbrook.

Sounds like Russ will stay in the starting lineup.

(via @SpectrumSN)

Darvin Ham was pleased with AD's ability to draw attention, get to the free throw line and defend the rim.

"I'm thrilled to see the type of numbers he put out there, we just got to do it for a full 48 minutes."

(via @SpectrumSN)
